disclaimer: Disclaimer: The following architectural design is a conceptual representation based on Traditional Kerala 'Nalukettu' style and does not substitute for professional architectural advice. Please consult certified professionals before implementation.

rooms.description: Open living space with traditional Kerala stone finishes, integrated courtyard adjacent to main entrance
Adjacent dining area that flows into the living area, offering views of the courtyard
Traditional Kerala kitchen with modern appliances discreetly housed in wooden cabinets. A small pantry is provided for storage.
Dedicated servants' quarters near service entrance, including a bedroom and small washroom.

openings.description: A large traditional wooden door with intricate carvings leading into the central courtyard
Balconies overlooking the courtyard for enhanced natural light and ventilation

rooms.description: Spacious master bedroom with an attached en-suite bathroom, featuring traditional Kerala wooden interiors and Vastu-compliant north or east facing view
Additional bedrooms arranged around the central courtyard for balanced natural lighting in accordance with Vastu principles
Additional bedroom space for flexibility, ensuring privacy and adherence to traditional spatial arrangements
Another bedroom offering a serene atmosphere with views of the courtyard or garden

openings.description: Large windows oriented according to Vastu principles for maximum natural light and ventilation
Small window alcoves in bedroom areas providing enhanced cross-ventilation

vastu_principles_note: Design incorporates Vastu principles such as proper alignment of main entrance facing east or north, placement of water elements and kitchen on the appropriate sides, and ensuring balanced space distribution for harmony.
